section.title: Sequencing devices
section.sectiontitle: Use Having + past participle or After + present participle to show the order of events when telling a story or describing a series of events.
section.text1: Sequence: 1) We discussed the problem 2) We decided to go out.
section.text1a: Having discussed the problem for several hours, we decided to go out for something to eat.
section.text2: Sequence: 1) She explained why she needed a raise. 2) She told the boss she was thinking of leaving.
section.text2a: After explaining to her boss why she needed a raise, she told him that she was thinking of leaving the company.
section.sectiontitle2: We can also use Before, On and While + -ing to show the order of events.
section.text3: Sequence: 1) She stripped off the old wallpaper. 2) She painted the room.
section.text3a: Before painting the room, she had to strip off the old wallpaper.
section.text4: Sequence: 1) He entered the room. 2) He noticed that the windows were open.
section.text4a: On entering the room, he noticed that all the windows were open.
